result.execSummary:
The defendant Danny V Wutke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).
  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Counseling deemed necessary.

Absolute sobriety.

No contact with victims, K.C. or D.P.

records.addlTxt: Terminated - regular
$429 pif  (NOTE: remaining $157.30 credit given on case 15TR4252)
Second Amended
11:45 Defendant Danny V Wutke in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Derek Dominguez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:25 Attorney Travis Stephen Slattery in court.  Derek Dominguez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Slattery states he does not know why defendant is not here. He asks that matter be set for another plea date. State requests warrant.
Court orders warrant. No bond.
Amended
Jury trial - 12 person on February 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.
State
Jury trial - 12 person on February 4, 2015 at 08:15 am.

10:03 Defendant Danny V Wutke in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has filed a motion to amend Information to drop one of the victims. Attorney Dominguez is removing A.K. as a victim. 
Attorney Slattery makes statement. He feels that this is prejudicial to the defendant.
Attorney Dominguez makes additional statement. He is not willing to stipulate at this time that A.K. is not available for trial. He is still trying to serve him. 
Court grants amendment and adjournment. Trial will be rescheduled for January. 
Attorney Slattery asks for ruling on motion in limines 4, 5 & 6. Attorney Slattery asks that a video be shown regarding a witness. Court grants motion #4 if witness denies smoking synthetic marijuana. Victim K.C. cannot be questioned regarding synthetic marijuana. Court states it will have to see how testimony comes in before definite ruling. Court would want to see video before shown to the jury. 
Motion #5 regarding comments defendant made about his wife be excluded. Attorney Dominguez feels it is relevant. Court grants motion #5.
Motion #6 that statements be excluded regarding the following day that defendant threatened them with a knife. Attorney Slattery makes statement. Court grants motion to exclude evidence. May be revisted during trial depending on testimony.
Attorney Slattery advises Court that State has not provided him with prior convictions of witnesses. Attorney Dominguez makes statement. Court will not make ruling on this matter.
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions
Defendant's Motions in Limine
and Witness List (Plaintiff)
to Amend the Charge
Motion hearing on December 12, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on December 15, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on November 12, 2014 at 08:15 am.

8:21 Defendant Danny V Wutke in court with attorney Emily M. Nolan-Plutchak.  Derek Dominguez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives preliminary hearing and enters plea of not guilty. Bond is continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 19, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on September 3, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Danny V Wutke in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Derek Dominguez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Dominguez makes statement regarding rescheduling preliminary hearing. Attorney Slattery makes statement regarding scheduling conflict due to trial.  Preliminary hearing to be rescheduled.  Time limits are waived.
(Defendant)
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on August 7, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Absolute sobriety. No weapons. No contact with A.K., D.P, K.C. and their residences.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on July 31, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Possess no weapons.  Absolute sobriety.  No contact w/KC, DP or AK or their residences.
Defendant Danny V Wutke in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery (SA).  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Bound over for further proceedings.
